response.answer_text: Cellulose is the most significant structural component of plant cell wall. Cellulose, polysaccharide containing repeated unbranched β (1-4) D-glucose units, is synthesized at the plasma membrane by the cellulose synthase complex (CSC) from bacteria to plants.[1] Footnotes[1] https://www.hindawi.com/journals/tswj/2016/8641373/
Cellulose is synthesized by plasma membrane-localized rosette cellulose synthase complexes and aided by cellulose synthase proteins.
